Package gui

Class cashierScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.cashierScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class cashierScreen
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Cashier screen for boba point of sale system. This class provides the interface for cashiers to create and manage drink orders, and includes tea selection, customization options, and order completion.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • cashierScreen

        public cashierScreen()
        This constructor initializes the cashier screen, sets up the header and footer, and creates all ingredient category panels (tea, flavor, topping, ice, sugar). It also fills in static maps for tea, flavor, and topping types and initializes their usage counts.

    • Method Detail

      • header

        private void header​(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        Creates and adds the header bar to the main frame. Contains the Home button and time.
        Parameters:
        frame - the application frame

      • newDrinkPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel newDrinkPanel​(int teaID,
                                         int flavorID,
                                         int toppingID,
                                         int iceID,
                                         int sugarID,
                                         double price,
                                         javax.swing.JPanel orderPanel,
                                         java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.Double> orderPrice,
                                         javax.swing.JLabel orderPriceLabel)
        Uses SQL queries to get the drink ingredient names from their IDs Creates a new panel containing drink ingredients, price, and remove button. Adds drink price to the total order price and update the order price label
        Parameters:
        teaID - the id number for the tea in the drink
        flavorID - the id number for the flavor in the drink
        toppingID - the id number for the topping in the drink
        iceID - the amount of ice in the drink
        sugarID - the amount of sugar in the drink
        price - the price of the drink
        orderPanel - the panel that the new drink panel will go on
        orderPrice - the total price of the order
        orderPriceLabel - the JLabel containing the total price of the order
        Returns:
        the created JPanel of the drink

      • buttonColorSwitcher

        private void buttonColorSwitcher​(javax.swing.JButton but,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<javax.swing.JButton> buttons)
        Changes button colors when pressed to a darker shade. Changes other buttons in the same button row back to the original color.
        Parameters:
        but - button that has been pressed
        buttons - all buttons in a row with original button

      • add

        private javax.swing.JButton add​(javax.swing.JPanel orderPanel,
                                java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.Double> orderPrice,
                                javax.swing.JLabel orderPriceLabel,
                                java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger teaID,
                                java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger toppingID,
                                java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger flavorID,
                                java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger iceID,
                                java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger sugarID)
        Creates the 'add' button that adds a customized drink to the current order. Queries the database for drink price, updates order display, and resets selections.
        Parameters:
        orderPanel - panel displaying all drinks
        orderPrice - reference to current order total
        orderPriceLabel - label displaying order total
        teaID - reference to tea ID
        toppingID - reference to topping ID
        flavorID - reference to flavor ID
        iceID - reference to ice level
        sugarID - reference to sugar level
        Returns:
        JButton to add drinks to order

      • createOptions

        private javax.swing.JPanel createOptions​(javax.swing.JPanel orderPanel,
                                         java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.Double> orderPrice,
                                         javax.swing.JLabel orderPriceLabel)
        Creates the main customization panel with all drink option buttons. Includes sections for tea selection, flavors, toppings, sugar, ice, and the 'add' button. Loads in seasonal items as well.
        Parameters:
        orderPanel - panel displaying current order
        orderPrice - atomic to order total
        orderPriceLabel - label displaying order total
        Returns:
        JPanel containing all customization options

      • completeOrder

        private javax.swing.JPanel completeOrder​(javax.swing.JPanel orderPanel,
                                         java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.Double> orderPrice,
                                         javax.swing.JLabel orderPriceLabel,
                                         javax.swing.JLabel orderLabel)
        Creates the complete order panel with the 'complete order' button. On click, prompts for employee ID, inserts order into database, and updates inventory accordingly.
        Parameters:
        orderPanel - panel displaying current order
        orderPrice - reference to current order total
        orderPriceLabel - label displaying order total
        orderLabel - label for current order
        Returns:
        JPanel containing complete order button

      • footer

        private void footer​(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        Creates and adds footer bar to main frame. Contains buttons for order history and log out functionality.
        Parameters:
        frame - application frame
